comments.commentBody:
Gary Antonick and D-Ferg #13:

D-Ferg's clarification is correct. Maybe I should have specified the 180 degree rotation I talked about was around the axis perpendicular to the 2-d plane, not one insider the plane. Maybe that was what lead Gary Antonick to the mirror reflection image, e.g. the left hand image at the bottom of the post. Is it right, Gary?
I'm a paper solver, so Paul's clever gimmick went right over my head.  Interesting fill when you consider what he's done.

Gary #12:

Please refer to Hans #2.

I suppose your "line of symmetry" refers to an axis about which the table is reflectively symmetric. As was pointed earlier in Hans #2, the table and the coin should be reflectively symmetric with respect to a point, not a line. Line will not work.

The cost of drugs is absolutely outrageous and all I can say is the expiration of patents couldn't come soon enough. Advertising budgets for drugs occupy a much more significant portion of their budget than does research and development. If pharmaceutical companies really want to save money, stop advertising. And the NIH and NCI should get increased funding for research, not have their budget slashed, as Republicans are suggesting.

I can't feel too sorry for pharmaceutical companies. The next big blockbuster drug was suppose to "cure" female sexual dysfunction, a "pink" viagra. We need that like a hole in the head and I'm glad the FDA shot it down.

Surprise, surprise, surprise!!!

And how about that $3.60+ gas price -- where's the outrage and hatred over that???

More and more I fear Obama is a one term prez.

He just doesnt have the spine - I don't always need to agree with my leader, but I do want to see him stand his ground. So far I've yet to see that with Obama- and at this rate, never will.
Hope and lost change.  Where is the quarter?
He lost my vote long ago

One promise at a time thrown into the wind. The candidate and president-elect who captured the imagination of me, my friends and family leaves us shrugging with embarrassment and quickly changing the subject.

Does it ever occur to citizens that our president has information that we do not know?  He does not have to answer to Democrats or Republicans; He has to answer to the United States of America.  I voted for him,  I trust him, and I support him, even though my every little wish might not be granted.  Obama is by far the best leader and president I have seen in 57 years.

Another broken promise made by our President Obama. The prison camp was to be closed, and now operations will continue as normal. Hopefully the American people will remember our president says one thing and does another. And the people will remember when he tries to be reelected in 2012. A vote from me he shall not receive.
I hope that those who voted for Obama based upon his vague rhetoric recognize his hypocracy now.

Sad... very very sad...
I refer to the American Public... Not President Obama...

To have followed any of this story is to be aware at least that Obama did indeed work to fulfill his promise.

It was the American public that lacked the spine to process the detainees in a more "American way."

It does seem that Obama has done much to try correct the poorly conceived and poorly implemented detention, interrogation, and 'processing' of detainees at the camps in Cuba.

It's sad that a serious, adult conversation seems so difficult to have... it's happened much to rarely in public for too long....

It's sad that in order to respond to the despicable, spineless acts of al Quaida, the United States chose to establish a place as "un-American" as the camps and facilities at the US Naval Station at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba... Ironic really, since it is the "Symbol" of "Americanism" that al Quaida was attacking... right?

That is all that any terrorist group of relatively small number and limited means can do... Attack symbols right? (Like the Oklahoma Fed. Bldg.). They can't actually "defeat" a nation of 200plus million people...

So why create a symbol like "GITMO" for them ..!?!?

That, I believe, is what Obama has been trying to correct.

SAD

To support President Obama's effort to close the camps in Cuba and to reform the procedures of trying the detainees is to support adherence to more 'American ideals'....

But maybe trying to maintain American ideals of behavior is too high minded and ... idealistic.... and somewhat fictional... like the idea of a 'Shining City on a Hill' ... That's just good Rhetoric... isn't it... like so much else...?

Sad...

~
DJE

Our President on both domestic and foreign policy is rapidly evolving from being Barack Obama to being Barack W. Obama.  At this rate, as a Republican, I may be able to vote for him in 2012.  Perhaps he will bolt from the Democratic Party to the Republicans--watch out Newt Gingrich.
How did he strengthen his knee without running on it?

I personally don't see a franchise type QB in this draft, if Carolina does take a QB , I think more than likely it would be Gabbert. I can see them taking Bowers 1st or possibly the DE out of UNC who I understand they are very high on due to his upside. I also agree with comment #1, Cam Newton in Denver just doesn't make sense .
very modest
You are such a disappointment Mr. President...!

Paul:

Declan Sullivan is dead, his story has been almost completely ignored by the press, and you respond with insult and denial?

Do you work for the Church of Rome?

Do not hate. Love is the superstar on my Fantasy team and I love how hard he works and how hard he tries for that rag-tag outfit. Get him a point guard, a center, a good shooting guard and a swing man and my boy will win a ring.
Wishy-washy.  What we need is another Lyndon Johnson or Harry Truman.  Presidents willing to make decisions and accept responsibility, knowing and announcing "where the buck stops".

"four legs good, two legs bad...." Orwell is right...

First Iraq and Afghanistan, then the continuation of tax breaks for the wealthy, and now Guantanamo?

I wonder what other campaign promises Obama pledges to break next? In all seriousness, the reason why there's no solid Republican challenger is because Obama himself is the best Republican candidate!

He still plans to close Guantanamo "some day"? As in.... 2020? Realistically, the problem of what to do with detainees that we can't try but can't release will not go away on its own. The upside of reelecting Obama is that perhaps, without 2012 breathing down his neck, he will have the spine to take the unpopular steps to shut down Guantanamo. It seems far more likely, though, that the president who closes the base will have to be a Republican who, in a Nixon-goes-to-China moment, will not be vulnerable to the GOP's "soft-on-security" attacks.
What a profound disappointment Obama has turned out to be as president.  Hopefully Grayson will challenge him in 2012.
Rachel Maddow for President in 2012!!!
